Other Information.Additional Info: The material's hierarchical pore structure allows small glycopeptides to pass through while excluding larger proteins.

Other Information.Test Conditions: Simulated biological samples with IgG and BSA mixtures
Other Information.Additional Info: Large proteins like BSA are excluded by the mesoporous silica shell, enhancing selectivity for glycopeptides.

Other Information.Test Conditions: Simulated biological samples with IgG and BSA mixtures
Other Information.Additional Info: High-abundance proteins such as IgG are effectively excluded due to the size-exclusion effect of the mesoporous channels.

Sieving Mechanism: Size exclusion at sub-nanometer scale via a hierarchical porous structure composed of microporous UiO-66-NH2 and mesoporous SiO2 shell.

Experimental Validation.Performance Metrics: 521 glycopeptides identified from 2 μL human serum; 342 glycopeptides identified from 2 μL mouse testis tissue.

Other Information.Additional Info: The mesoporous SiO2 layer enhances stability in aqueous solutions and improves enrichment specificity for glycopeptides by excluding large proteins.
